wisdom.sentence: A "critic" is a man who creates nothing and thereby feels qualified to judge the work of creative men. There is logic in this; he is unbiased -- he hates all creative people equally.
A celebrity is a person who is known for his well-knownness.
A copy of the universe is not what is required of art; one of the damned things is ample.
wisdom.author: Rebecca West

wisdom.sentence: A critic is a bundle of biases held loosely together by a sense of taste.
wisdom.author: Whitney Balliett

wisdom.sentence: A diva who specializes in risque arias is an off-coloratura soprano.
A drama critic is a person who surprises a playwright by informing him what he meant.
wisdom.author: Wilson Mizner

wisdom.sentence: A fool-proof method for sculpting an elephant: first, get a huge block of marble; then you chip away everything that doesn't look like an elephant.

A hard-luck actor who appeared in one coloossal disaster after another finally got a break, a broken leg to be exact.Someone pointed out that it's the first time the poor fellow's been in the same cast for more than a week.
A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
A musical reviewer admitted he always praised the first show of a new theatrical season."Who am I to stone the first cast?"
A poet who reads his verse in public may have other nasty habits.
A sequel is an admission that you've been reduced to imitating yourself.
wisdom.author: Don Marquis

wisdom.sentence: A shy teenage boy finally worked up the nerve to give a gift to Madonna, a young puppy. It hitched its waggin' to a star.
A team effort is a lot of people doing what I say.
wisdom.author: Michael Winner, British film director

wisdom.sentence: A true artist will let his wife starve, his children go barefoot, his mother drudge for his living at seventy, sooner than work at anything but his art.
wisdom.author: Shaw

wisdom.sentence: A writer is congenitally unable to tell the truth and that is why we call what he writes fiction.
wisdom.author: William Faulkner

wisdom.sentence: A yawn is a silent shout.
wisdom.author: G.K. Chesterton

wisdom.sentence: Acting is an art which consists of keeping the audience from coughing.
Actors will happen even in the best-regulated families.
Actresses will happen in the best regulated families.
wisdom.author: Addison Mizner and Oliver Herford, "The Entirely New Cynic's Calendar", 1905

wisdom.sentence: Adding sound to movies would be like putting lipstick on the Venus de Milo.
wisdom.author: Actress Mary Pickford, 1925

wisdom.sentence: Adhere to your own act, and congratulate yourself if you have done something strange and extravagant, and broken the monotony of a decorous age.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.sentence: Alex Haley was adopted!
All art is but imitation of nature.
wisdom.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

wisdom.sentence: An actor's a guy who if you ain't talkin' about him, ain't listening.
wisdom.author: Marlon Brando

wisdom.sentence: An artist should be fit for the best society and keep out of it.
Any fool can paint a picture, but it takes a wise person to be able to sell it.
"Are you police officers?" "No, ma'am.  We're musicians."
wisdom.author: The Blues Brothers

wisdom.sentence: Art is a jealous mistress.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.sentence: Art is a lie which makes us realize the truth.

wisdom.sentence: Art is anything you can get away with.
wisdom.author: Marshall McLuhan

wisdom.sentence: Art is either plagiarism or revolution.
wisdom.author: Paul Gauguin

wisdom.sentence: Art is Nature speeded up and God slowed down.
wisdom.author: Chazal

wisdom.sentence: Art is the tree of life.  Science is the tree of death.
As a goatherd learns his trade by goat, so a writer learns his trade by wrote.
Asking a working writer what he thinks about critics is like asking a lamp-post how it feels about dogs.
wisdom.author: Christopher Hampton

wisdom.sentence: Authors (and perhaps columnists) eventually rise to the top of whatever depths they were once able to plumb.
wisdom.author: Stanley Kaufman

wisdom.sentence: Authors are easy to get on with -- if you're fond of children.
wisdom.author: Michael Joseph, "Observer"

wisdom.sentence: Bahdges?  We don't need no stinkin' bahdges!
wisdom.author: "The Treasure of Sierra Madre"

wisdom.sentence: Be regular and orderly in your life, so that you may be violent and original in your work.
wisdom.author: Flaubert

wisdom.sentence: Being a mime means never having to say you're sorry.
"Being disintegrated makes me ve-ry an-gry!" <huff, huff>
Ben, why didn't you tell me?

wisdom.sentence: "Benson, you are so free of the ravages of intelligence"
wisdom.author: Time Bandits

wisdom.sentence: Burnt Sienna.  That's the best thing that ever happened to Crayolas.
wisdom.author: Ken Weaver

wisdom.sentence: But if you wish at once to do nothing and to be respectable nowdays, the best pretext is to be at work on some profound study.
wisdom.author: Leslie Stephen, "Sketches from Cambridge"

wisdom.sentence: But you shall not escape my iambics.
wisdom.author: Gaius Valerius Catullus

wisdom.sentence: Can't act.  Slightly bald.  Also dances.

wisdom.sentence: Disco is to music what Etch-A-Sketch is to art.
Don't everyone thank me at once!

wisdom.sentence: Dustin Farnum:Why, yesterday, I had the audience glued to their seats! Oliver Herford: Wonderful!  Wonderful!Clever of you to think of it!

wisdom.sentence: Dying is easy.Comedy is difficult.
wisdom.author: Actor Edmond Gween, on his deathbed.

wisdom.sentence: E.T. GO HOME!!! (And take your Smurfs with you.)
Ed Sullivan will be around as long as someone else has talent.

wisdom.sentence: Eeny, Meeny, Jelly Beanie, the spirits are about to speak!
wisdom.author: Bullwinkle Moose

wisdom.sentence: Elwood: What kind of music do you get here ma'am? Barmaid: Why, we get both kinds of music, Country and Western.

wisdom.sentence: Everyone is in the best seat.

wisdom.sentence: Fame lost its appeal for me when I went into a public restroom and an autograph seeker handed me a pen and paper under the stall door.

wisdom.sentence: "First things first -- but not necessarily in that order"

wisdom.sentence: Fools rush in -- and get the best seats in the house.
For the next hour, WE will control all that you see and hear.
Forms follow function, and often obliterate it.
Fremen add life to spice!
Gauls! We have nothing to fear; except perhaps that the sky may fall on our heads tomorrow.  But as we all know, tomorrow never comes!!
wisdom.author: Adventures of Asterix

wisdom.sentence: Go ahead... make my day.
wisdom.author: Dirty Harry

wisdom.sentence: God help the troubadour who tries to be a star. The more that you try to find success, the more that you will fail.
wisdom.author: Phil Ochs, on the Second System Effect

wisdom.sentence: God is really only another artist.  He invented the giraffe, the elephant and the cat.  He has no real style, He just goes on trying other things.

wisdom.sentence: God save us from a bad neighbor and a beginner on the fiddle.

wisdom.sentence: H. L. Mencken suffers from the hallucination that he is H. L. Mencken -- there is no cure for a disease of that magnitude.

wisdom.sentence: "Hawk, we're going to die." "Never say die... and certainly never say we."

wisdom.sentence: He was a fiddler, and consequently a rogue.

wisdom.sentence: "Hello," he lied.

wisdom.sentence: Hi Jimbo.  Dennis.  Really appreciate the help on the income tax.  You wanna help on the audit now?

wisdom.sentence: Hollywood is where if you don't have happiness you send out for it.

wisdom.sentence: How wonderful opera would be if there were no singers.

Humpty Dumpty was pushed.
I always had a repulsive need to be something more than human.
wisdom.author: David Bowie

wisdom.sentence: I am a deeply superficial person.
wisdom.author: Andy Warhol

wisdom.sentence: I can't understand why a person will take a year or two to write a novel when he can easily buy one for a few dollars.

wisdom.sentence: I didn't do it! Nobody saw me do it! Can't prove anything!

wisdom.sentence: I didn't like the play, but I saw it under adverse conditions.The curtain was up.

wisdom.author: Elvis Presley

wisdom.sentence: I have a very strange feeling about this...

wisdom.sentence: "I have come up with a sure-fire concept for a hit television show, which would be called `A Live Celebrity Gets Eaten by a Shark'."

wisdom.sentence: I have had my television aerials removed.  It's the moral equivalent of a prostate operation.

wisdom.sentence: I knew her before she was a virgin.
wisdom.author: Oscar Levant, on Doris Day

wisdom.sentence: I never failed to convince an audience that the best thing they could do was to go away.
I never made a mistake in my life.  I thought I did once, but I was wrong.
wisdom.author: Lucy Van Pelt

wisdom.sentence: I often quote myself; it adds spice to my conversation.

wisdom.sentence: I remember Ulysses well...  Left one day for the post office to mail a letter, met a blonde named Circe on the streetcar, and didn't come back for 20 years.

I stick my neck out for nobody.
wisdom.author: Humphrey Bogart, "Casablanca"

wisdom.sentence: I stopped believing in Santa Claus when I was six.  Mother took me to see him in a department store and he asked for my autograph.

wisdom.sentence: I suggest a new strategy, Artoo: let the Wookie win.

wisdom.sentence: I used to be disgusted, now I find I'm just amused.

wisdom.sentence: I watch television because you don't know what it will do if you leave it in the room alone.

wisdom.sentence: I went to a Grateful Dead Concert and they played for SEVEN hours.  Great song.

wisdom.sentence: I WISH I HAD A KRYPTONITE CROSS, because then you could keep both Dracula and Superman away.

wisdom.sentence: I wish there was a knob on the TV to turn up the intelligence.There's a knob called "brightness", but it doesn't seem to work.

wisdom.sentence: I'd just as soon kiss a Wookie.

wisdom.sentence: I'll be Grateful when they're Dead.

wisdom.sentence: I'm a Hollywood writer; so I put on a sports jacket and take off my brain.

wisdom.sentence: I've got a very bad feeling about this.

wisdom.sentence: If *I* had a hammer, there'd be no more folk singers.

wisdom.sentence: If Beethoven's Seventh Symphony is not by some means abridged, it will soon fall into disuse.

If I had any humility I would be perfect.

wisdom.sentence: If I have to lay an egg for my country, I'll do it.
wisdom.author: Bob Hope

wisdom.sentence: If it ain't baroque, don't phiques it.

wisdom.sentence: If you have to ask what jazz is, you'll never know.

wisdom.sentence: If you lose a son you can always get another, but there's only one Maltese Falcon.

wisdom.sentence: If you think the pen is mightier than the sword, the next time someone pulls out a sword I'd like to see you get up there with your Bic.

wisdom.sentence: Imitation is the sincerest form of television.

wisdom.sentence: Immature artists imitate, mature artists steal.

wisdom.sentence: Immature poets imitate, mature poets steal.

wisdom.sentence: In just seven days, I can make you a man!

wisdom.sentence: In Oz, never say "krizzle kroo" to a Woozy.

The human animal differs from the lesser primates in his passion for lists of "Ten Best".
wisdom.author: H. Allen Smith

wisdom.sentence: The human brain is a wonderful thing.  It starts working the moment you are born, and never stops until you stand up to speak in public.
wisdom.author: Sir George Jessel

wisdom.sentence: The human brain is like an enormous fish -- it is flat and slimy and has gills through which it can see.
wisdom.author: Monty Python

wisdom.sentence: The last vestiges of the old Republic have been swept away.
wisdom.author: Governor Tarkin

wisdom.sentence: The mome rath isn't born that could outgrabe me.
wisdom.author: Nicol Williamson

wisdom.sentence: The older I grow, the less important the comma becomes. Let the reader catch his own breath.
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Clarkson Zwart

wisdom.sentence: The only "ism" Hollywood believes in is plagiarism.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.sentence: The only real advantage to punk music is that nobody can whistle it.
The plot was designed in a light vein that somehow became varicose.
wisdom.author: David Lardner

wisdom.sentence: The Ranger isn't gonna like it, Yogi.
The real trouble with reality is that there's no background music.
The story you are about to hear is true.  Only the names have been changed to protect the innocent.
The streets were dark with something more than night.
wisdom.author: Raymond Chandler

wisdom.sentence: The sun never sets on those who ride into it.
wisdom.author: RKO

wisdom.sentence: The trouble with superheros is what to do between phone booths.
wisdom.author: Ken Kesey

wisdom.sentence: The typewriting machine, when played with expression, is no more annoying than the piano when played by a sister or near relation.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: The ultimate game show will be the one where somebody gets killed at the end.
wisdom.author: Chuck Barris, creator of "The Gong Show"

wisdom.sentence: The world has many unintentionally cruel mechanisms that are not designed for people who walk on their hands.
wisdom.author: John Irving, "The World According to Garp"

wisdom.sentence: There are three rules for writing a novel.  Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.
wisdom.author: Somerset Maugham

wisdom.sentence: There are two ways of disliking art.   One is to dislike it.  The other is to like it rationally.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: There are two ways of disliking poetry; one way is to dislike it, the other is to read Pope.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: There is much Obi-Wan did not tell you.
wisdom.author: Darth Vader

wisdom.sentence: There is nothing wrong with writing ... as long as it is done in private and you wash your hands afterward.
There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: There's nothing remarkable about it.  All one has to do is hit the right keys at the right time and the instrument plays itself.
wisdom.author: J.S. Bach

wisdom.sentence: There's nothing to writing.  All you do is sit at a typewriter and open a vein.
wisdom.author: Red Smith

wisdom.sentence: There's something the technicians need to learn from the artists. If it isn't aesthetically pleasing, it's probably wrong.
There's such a thing as too much point on a pencil.
wisdom.author: H. Allen Smith, "Let the Crabgrass Grow"

wisdom.sentence: They can't stop us... we're on a mission from God!
wisdom.author: The Blues Brothers

wisdom.sentence: This door is baroquen, please wiggle Handel. (If I wiggle Handel, will it wiggle Bach?)
wisdom.author: Found on a door in the MSU music building

wisdom.sentence: This novel is not to be tossed lightly aside, but to be hurled with great force.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.sentence: This unit... must... survive.
This wasn't just plain terrible, this was fancy terrible.  This was terrible with raisins in it.
wisdom.author: Dorothy Parker

wisdom.sentence: Three actors, Tom, Fred, and Cec, wanted to do the jousting scene from Don Quixote for a local TV show.  "I'll play the title role," proposed Tom.  "Fred can portray Sancho Panza, and Cecil B. De Mille."
Three hours a day will produce as much as a man ought to write.
wisdom.author: Trollope

wisdom.sentence: To be is to do.
wisdom.author: I. Kant

wisdom.sentence: To do is to be.
wisdom.author: A. Sartre

wisdom.sentence: Do be a Do Bee!
wisdom.author: Miss Connie, Romper Room

wisdom.sentence: Do be do be do!
wisdom.author: F. Sinatra

wisdom.sentence: Yabba-Dabba-Doo!
wisdom.author: F. Flintstone

wisdom.sentence: Today you'll start getting heavy metal radio on your dentures.
"Today, of course, it is considered very poor taste to use the F-word except in major motion pictures."
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.sentence: Traveling through hyperspace isn't like dusting crops, boy.
wisdom.author: Han Solo

wisdom.sentence: Trifles make perfection, and perfection is no trifle.
wisdom.author: Michelangelo

wisdom.sentence: "Truth is stranger than fiction, because fiction has to make sense."
TV is chewing gum for the eyes.
wisdom.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

wisdom.sentence: Unprovided with original learning, unformed in the habits of thinking, unskilled in the arts of composition, I resolved to write a book.
wisdom.author: Edward Gibbon

wisdom.sentence: Use an accordion.  Go to jail.
wisdom.author: KFOG, San Francisco

wisdom.sentence: Use what talents you possess: the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
wisdom.author: Henry Van Dyke

wisdom.sentence: Watch all-night Donna Reed reruns until your mind resembles oatmeal.
Watch your mouth, kid, or you'll find yourself floating home.
wisdom.author: Han Solo

wisdom.sentence: We don't like their sound.  Groups of guitars are on the way out.
wisdom.author: Decca Recording Company, turning down the Beatles, 1962

wisdom.sentence: We have art that we do not die of the truth.
wisdom.author: Nietzsche

wisdom.sentence: We'll be recording at the Paradise Friday night.  Live, on the Death label.
wisdom.author: Swan, "Phantom of the Paradise"

wisdom.sentence: We'll know that rock is dead when you have to get a degree to work in it.
We're only in it for the volume.
wisdom.author: Black Sabbath

wisdom.sentence: Wharbat darbid yarbou sarbay?
What an artist dies with me!
wisdom.author: Nero

wisdom.sentence: What an author likes to write most is his signature on the back of a cheque.
wisdom.author: Brendan Francis

wisdom.sentence: What did you bring that book I didn't want to be read to out of about Down Under up for?
"What do you do when your real life exceeds your wildest fantasies?" "You keep it to yourself."
wisdom.author: Broadcast News

wisdom.sentence: What ever happened to happily ever after?
What garlic is to food, insanity is to art.
What no spouse of a writer can ever understand is that a writer is working when he's staring out the window.
When all else fails, try Kate Smith.
When confronted by a difficult problem, you can solve it more easily by reducing it to the question, "How would the Lone Ranger handle this?"
When in doubt, have a man come through the door with a gun in his hand.
wisdom.author: Raymond Chandler

wisdom.sentence: Where is John Carson now that we need him?
wisdom.author: RLG

wisdom.sentence: Whistler's mother is off her rocker.
Who is D.B. Cooper, and where is he now?
Who is John Galt?
Who is W.O. Baker, and why is he saying those terrible things about me?
Who was that masked man?
Who's on first?
Who's scruffy-looking?
wisdom.author: Han Solo

wisdom.sentence: Why am I so soft in the middle when the rest of my life is so hard?
wisdom.author: Paul Simon

wisdom.sentence: "Why are we importing all these highbrow plays like `Amadeus'?I could have told you Mozart was a jerk for nothing."
wisdom.author: Ian Shoales

wisdom.sentence: Why do we have two eyes?  To watch 3-D movies with.
Why you say you no bunny rabbit when you have little powder-puff tail?
wisdom.author: The Tasmanian Devil

wisdom.sentence: Working with Julie Andrews is like getting hit over the head with a valentine.
wisdom.author: Christopher Plummer

wisdom.sentence: Worth seeing?  Yes, but not worth going to see.
Would it help if I got out and pushed?
wisdom.author: Princess Leia Organa

wisdom.sentence: Writing about music is like dancing about architecture.
wisdom.author: Frank Zappa

wisdom.sentence: Writing free verse is like playing tennis with the net down.
X-rated movies are all alike ... the only thing they leave to the imagination is the plot.
Yevtushenko has... an ego that can crack crystal at a distance of twenty feet.
wisdom.author: John Cheever

wisdom.sentence: "You boys lookin' for trouble?" "Sure.Whaddya got?"
wisdom.author: Marlon Brando, "The Wild Ones"

wisdom.sentence: You're all clear now, kid.  Now blow this thing so we can all go home.
wisdom.author: Han Solo

wisdom.sentence: "You've got to have a gimmick if your band sucks."
wisdom.author: Gary Giddens

wisdom.sentence: Zero Mostel: That's it baby!  When you got it, flaunt it!  Flaunt it!
wisdom.author: Mel Brooks, "The Producers"
